caption.p: Central nervous system imaging abnormalities in patients with chikungunya infection. A, Signal abnormality involving the periventricular white matter in an 85‐year‐old patient with encephalitis (axial fluid‐attenuated inversion recovery). 44 B, Confluent areas of signal abnormality consistent with demyelination in an 8‐year‐old patient with acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (coronal T2). 92 C, Signal abnormality (hyperintense) involving the corpus callosum and the frontal and parietal lobes in neonate A with vertically acquired encephalopathy (day 6, axial diffusion weighted imaging). 105 D, Signal abnormality (hypointense) involving the frontal and parietal lobes in neonate B with vertically acquired encephalopathy (day 21, axial diffusion‐weighted imaging). 105 E, Signal abnormality at T12 in a 47‐year‐old patient with myeloradiculopathy (sagittal T1) 63
